{"step_by_step_thinking": "The sublingual salivary gland is one of the three major salivary glands in the human body. It is located in the mouth, beneath the tongue, which is inferior to the mylohyoid muscle. The mylohyoid muscle forms the floor of the mouth, and the sublingual gland is located below this muscle. Therefore, it is not superior to the mylohyoid, nor is it deep to the genioglossus or geniohyoid.", "answer_choice": "B. Inferior to mylohyoid"}
